subject: RE: [junit] Re: Can i do a assertion inside the setUp() method.
msgSnippet: ... I disagree on the grounds that the assert*() methods are just executed as regular methods.  By which I mean they have no part in the JUnit TestCase life
messageBody:
> From: Jeff.Langr@... [mailto:Jeff.Langr@...]
>
> From: Jim Dixon <jdd@...>
> > However, you should NEVER put an assertion in setUp().

I disagree on the grounds that the assert*() methods are just executed as regular methods. By which I mean they have no part in the JUnit TestCase life cycle or contractual relationship with the test runner. They don't fire events and they don't get invoked via reflection like test*() methods do. They're just methods for asserting boolean conditions. As such, I think they can be useful in setUp() or tearDown() as long as they're used in the general assertion capability way that Jeff seems to be using them.

I guess it would follow from my argument that if one is using JDK 1.4 APIs, one could just as well use the assert keyword where he's using JUnit assert() methods in setUp() and tearDown(). Eh? Never thought of that before.

Best,
Scott Stirling
Workscape, Inc.
